snippet: Salim Joubran, a Christian and Israel’s only Arab justice, does not sing the national anthem, a move that some on the right view as disloyal while the left urges a rethinking of the song’s lyrics.
abstract: Memo from Israel; Christian Arab Justice Salim Joubran refuses to sing Israel's national anthem during Chief Justice Dorit Beinisch's retirement ceremony, quickly sparking controversy; some Parliament members view act as disloyal while others urge a rethinking of the song's lyrics.
lead_paragraph: Salim Joubran, a Christian and Israel’s only Arab justice, does not sing the national anthem, a move that some on the right view as disloyal while the left urges a rethinking of the song’s lyrics.

headline.seo: Anger and Compassion for Justice Who Stays Silent During Hymn
headline.main: Anger and Compassion for Arab Justice Who Stays Silent During Zionist Hymn
headline.print_headline: Anger and Compassion for Arab Justice Who Stays Silent During Zionist Hymn
